message.content:
cs.CR, cs.NI, cs.SI, cs.DC, cs.SE 

This paper discusses the privacy risks and potential performance problems associated with DNS-over-HTTPS (DoH) and proposes decentralized architectures as a solution. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CR (Cryptography and Security), followed by cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) and cs.SI (Social and Information Networks). The paper also discusses the centralization of DNS queries, which falls under the scope of cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing) and proposes new architectures, which falls under cs.SE (Software Engineering).
